header.div: Questions 1-5. Listen to the recording, which will play automatically, and follow the instructions. Write the appropriate letters A-C against Questions 1-5.

div.p:
1. a rise in life expectancy
She expresses a positive opinion She does not express a strong opinion either way She expresses a negative opinion

2. a growing percentage of old people in the population
She expresses a positive opinion She does not express a strong opinion either way She expresses a negative opinion

3. a longer working life
She expresses a positive opinion She does not express a strong opinion either way She expresses a negative opinion

4. greater dependence on private pension funds
She expresses a positive opinion She does not express a strong opinion either way She expresses a negative opinion

5. family responsibility for the care of the elderly
She expresses a positive opinion She does not express a strong opinion either way She expresses a negative opinion

section.p: 1. The lecturer describes a rise in life expectancy as exciting and a wonderful opportunity. These are very positive adjectives.
2. The lecturer says she sees problems for societies with ageing populations and talks about drawbacks. Drawbacks are disadvantages or problems and so negative.
3. The lecturer says she strongly supports people being able to retire when it suits them, therefore working for longer.
4. The lecturer says that people will have to organise their own pensions but she doesn't say what she thinks about this.
5. The lecturer says it's unlikely that old people will be cared for at home but she doesn't express an opinion on this.
